meanings.definition: Having the shape of a circle or sphere.
meanings.sent1: The moon looked orbicular in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The orbicular table fit perfectly in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The orbicular cake was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an orbicular melody filling the room.
meanings.sent5: The orbicular window provided a beautiful view of the garden.

meanings.definition: Something that is circular or spherical in shape.
meanings.sent1: She gazed at the orbicular of the crystal ball.
meanings.sent2: The marble was a perfect orbicular.
meanings.sent3: The orbicular of the pizza made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The orbicular of the earth is a wonder from space.
meanings.sent5: The orbicular of the pearl shone in the sunlight.
